name: Grand Pacific Hotel

reviews.title: Not a good hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is advertised as 4 star but does not live up to its star rating. The rooms advertised on their website do not live up to the rooms you are given. The rooms shown on the website are apparently their executive suites. We were given a deluxe room which isnt even shown on the hotels website. We were then moved to another room which had bed bugs. I dont know what the procedure is with dealing with bed bugs, as this was a first for us, but I do not think the hotel dealt sufficiently with our personal effects to be sure they were not infected. We felt the rooms were dirty, especially at the base of the walls and edge of carpet, the bathrooms are very tiny. The pool closes at 9p.m. which was a real pain as when you are hot and tired after a hot day/night in Singapore it would have been lovely to have had a swim to cool down. We really did not enjoy our stay in this hotel.
Formerly called Allson. Allson was 2* post renovation they are a good 4* hotel.
reviews.title: Good as a 4*

reviews.text: Efficient.
reviews.title: not reaching the necessary levels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its one of those occasions when bad first impressions results in complaints about small problems throughout the stay. A very rude/abrupt check-in, no double beds available and it goes downhill from there. Pillows were like bricks, decor is old chinese (dark) and dated. No spoon for coffees (just a plastic stirer)
reviews.title: There are plenty of rooms for improvement

reviews.text: Good points - Room/Bathroom size is OK, free internet (but you have to pay a deposit for the cable - its that type of place), location is 5 mins from Raffles Hotel and MRT. At $200 a night its not worth it. Get it for less than $150 and its OK
reviews.title: Average hotel in convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Happy People with some niggles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have visited the Grand Pacific Hotel many, many times over the last eight years, sometimes with friends, sometimes four times per year and have always been happy with our stays. The staff are great, I even get welcomed with a kiss and a hug from all the Concierges who are great people.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The rooms are standard rooms that we book although you can book premier rooms for 25 UKP a night more, this room comes with breakfast usually. The standard rooms are rosewood and are a comfortable size and have all the usual things in the room. The hotel has a pool and one thing which I think hotels should have is a self service laundry ($6.00 plus $6.00 SP). The Grand Pacific has this and that is super handy to have.
reviews.title: You can do so much better in Singapore

reviews.text: The only drawback we have since we have been visiting the Grand Pacific Hotel, the rooms have gone up from 53 UKP to 110 UKP per night since 2009. This price would include breakfast for two people. I would like to ask the question why? I expect price rises but not that much. They are pricing themselves out of existance where many people cannot afford to pay these prices, expecially people like ourselves who go for a week or so at a time. They don't do a long stay rate which is extremely unusual nor Corporate rates.
reviews.title: Cold

reviews.text: We have been told for the last three years that the rooms are being upgraded, the standard room that we were in hadn't been. We used to get high floors but now they won't put us any higher than floor 9. However, the premier rooms are the higher rooms. We have also noticed that the hotel is never full, only 50% full, so why don't they lower their prices and include breakfast and it would be brilliant.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best.

reviews.text: It was an okay hotel. Nothing fancy. The rooms were a bit old and small. The outlets were hidden from view. They do have good service and a very delicious breakfast buffet. I would probably come back because its cheap and has a good location.
reviews.title: An okay hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights prior to boarding our cruise ship and the hotel appeared a bit dated though the standards we received in all respects were very high. Our room was small but contained all the amenities one would expect-kettle,iron,hairdryer,combination safe and the standard of hygiene was impressive and the beds were very comfortable.Reception and concierge staff were very efficient and helpful. The on site restaurant was excellent and we had buffet breakfast each morning and this was excellent and we ate there one evening and the food was fantastic and delicious.The hotel was very central to all the sights allowing us to experience a lot of Singapore in a little time!
reviews.title: Good hotel,dated but extremely clean and efficient

reviews.text: This was a nice hotel with comfortable rooms and great service. Our doorman Velu booked us some great packages and all the staff did their jobs well.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, comfortable rooms just what we needed

reviews.text: Stayed here for 10 nights. It was a solid hotel; clean and functional but nothing fancy. Don't be fooled by their advertisement of a "gym"--it's merely nothing more than two treadmills and two stationary bikes. And don't forget to plug in the treadmills when you want to use them. The outside garden/pool area is lovely but since it was rather rainy we didn't get to use the pool. The breakfasts are included and it's a pretty expansive all-you-can-eat buffet. There are two 7-11s near the hotel so that you can grab some water and maybe other things to keep in your mini-fridge. The hotel is located close to Raffles City and the Raffles Hotel, and in easy walking distance of the marina and even Arab Street (so called in local parlance.) The hotel staff is quite accommodating and helpful. All in all this was a solid 3-star hotel.
reviews.title: Solid hotel, nothing fancy

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the location -- you are able to reach everything in the center of the city by walking (for Marina Bay I would take a bus or a taxi). Big and clean rooms with standard amenities and comfortable beds. Gym is quite small. For a business trip I'd stay again but for a longer holiday I would probably choose something else like Marina Bay Sands.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: We (two adults & 1 child) spent 5 nights at the Grand Pacific and loved it! The location is terrific, close to shops, restaurants, malls, even a 7-11 next door, right on a bus route and walking distance to other transport.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff

reviews.text: We agree with other reviewers about the standard of the rooms which definitely need a make-over and some updating! The bathroom is tiny, but there is a bath/shower and complimentary soap/gels/shampoo etc. Bed was very hard and pillows need replacing ): Our daughter's rollaway bed was comfy by her standard. Room was clean, housekeeping staff friendly and unobtrusive (and respected the 'do not disturb' sign - happy to come back later without complaint, not usual in hotels these days!)
reviews.title: A good hotel which needs renovation

reviews.text: The staff were first-rate (except for one of the front desk ladies who had some real attitude which was quickly doused by the duty manager!!); they were especially helpful and caring when my husband fell ill and required a doctor and then a wheelchair. Management sent up a courtesy fruit basket and regularly checked on my husband's welfare. The concierge/s (all three) were fantastic with helpful suggestions and advice, and the restaurant/cafe staff went out of their way to help when my husband was in the wheelchair. They were also very child friendly, making life easier for our 6 year old!
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: No wi-fi in the room (but cable link available for $10/day), no drinks in the mini-bar fridge (7-11 next door to buy your own), no drama. Nice pool with sun lounges, cafe chairs/tables and plenty of shade or sun as you prefer.
reviews.title: Ok, Fair budget Hotel, Good Location

reviews.text: We booked through SIA Holidays and would highly recommend the hotel (great rate) especially if you want to be seen as a guest and not just another number checking in!
reviews.title: Centrally located hotels in singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree heartily with all the comments made by other positive reviewers. We stayed here for five nights on a SIA stopover. We had stayed here eight years earlier and liked the place and were not to be disappointed a second time.
reviews.title: A good choice hotel

reviews.text: Probably the hotel's greatest advantage is its location. You could not want to be any more central. Shopping in Orchard Road is a 15 min walk away, the harbour a 10 min walk and the nearest station only a short stroll.
reviews.title: Great Service, Good Location, Nice Room

reviews.text: As has been stated, the rooms are a little dated. We had expected that following the name change, the hotel might have up-graded its rooms. They hadn't (or at least the rooms on the floor we stayed in). Still, for just over 100€, we were not complaining! Everything in the room worked well, the beds were comfortable and all was very clean. The room standard reminded me of a Mercure Hotel: not top-luxury but excellent value. The hotel pool was the ideal place at the end of a hot day, not too busy and well maintained.
reviews.title: Never go there! Worst place I've ever been.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff helpful and were delighted to be able to get into our bedroom when we arrived early at 7.30am.
reviews.title: Welcomed with a warm smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only disappointment was the breakfast. Expensive and rather limited. No cereal or milk products were on offer and the croissants less than appealing. Still, Raffles City was just around the corner! Internet access can be found at the centre just opposite the hotel at $2, rather than paying the $20 per hour at the hotel.
reviews.title: Very good location, friendly staff

reviews.text: Stayed 1 night on a SIA Stopover. Small, dark & dingy room which smelt and felt very damp - triggered my son's asthma!! I paid for 2 nights as we were arriving at 7 am after a long overnight flight. When we arrived we were told the room would not be ready until after 8 am!! Not very happy I had to argue with staff to get a room as, technically, I'd paid for the room to be ready from 2 pm the day before!! I suppose that was Singapore Stopovers fault? Never ate in the hotel so can't comment on the food. We were out sight-seeing till late, then up early the following morning for our flight. The hotel's location was good - within walking distance of many of Singapore's sights.
reviews.title: Not Good!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a three day stopover. The hotel itself is an older style, with our room looking older, darker and in a chinese style, but having said that the bathroom and room was clean and comfortable (if a little overpriced). The location of the hotel is it's main selling point. Bus stops are directly across the road and about 20 metres down from the front door, from here we found that we could get to just about anywhere in Singapore. There are plenty of resturants and shopping malls close by, and within walking distance to the Raffles complex and Orchard Road.
reviews.title: Only three star, but clean and comfortable, terrific location

reviews.text: The staff I found were a bit standoffish, but efficient. Breakfast in the dining room was lovely, with ample asian and western style foods and plenty of it. There is a nice swimming pool on the fourth floor which we didn't know about until the second last day there as the booklet about the hotel was hidden away in the back of one of the drawers.
reviews.title: Good location & clean - no frills hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay here again, yes, I think I would!
reviews.title: not a 4 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Grand Pacific
reviews.title: Location good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time visit to this hotel. Although a change of name, no obvious upgrade improvements evident apart from reception moved to ground floor.Bar area cordoned off, I presume for upgrade. We had a room upgrade to executive class on floor 16, but didn't equate to its title. Room clean and tidy,towels still embossed with "Allson" logo. Furniture old and heavy dark wood looking. No radio in room, TV (old crt tv) channel selection not as good as previous stay. A smell of paint in corridors may indicate refurbishment on other floors. Reception and concierge staff most pleasant and very helpful. The hotel is not far from the tube (MRT) and there are bus stops a few yards along Victoria St. and on the other side of the road. Close to shopping areas and 10 mins walk from Raffles Hotel.
reviews.title: Convenient Location
Good location - overall a comfortable short stay
reviews.text: John
Room 709 - 2 night Singapore Airlines Stopover - room only
reviews.title: Paint fumes overpowering

reviews.text: This hotel has obviously been around for a while and the dark furnishings seem a littlle dated - but the room was clean, well equipped and comfortable with great air conditioning and a good firm mattress on the bed I used.
reviews.title: Good location clean and amazing pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good - easy access to MTR stations and many buses run along Victoria Street and both transport options are very easy to use. Plenty of eating options close by and not far to walk to access the free SQ hop on hop off sightseeing bus
reviews.title: Wonderfull hotel, great room, service, and location.

reviews.text: My young daughter and I stayed for a week and had a great time. The hotel is very central, just down the road from Bugis Junction and Raffles city. It is also really close to the Bras Basah MRT station, which will take you wherever you need to go. We stayed in one of the unrefurbished rooms on the fifth floor, which was fine, though a little worn out. Was also great that they had laundry facilities so we could do our washing while we swam in the pool.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night just your basic hotel. In good central location. The bedroom was small but the bed comfortable. Bathroom very outdated.
reviews.title: Basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staf very pleasant and very helpfully.
reviews.title: A good SIA stopover choice

reviews.text: They charge 5 dollars an hour for the Internet and you can only use it at reception .Internet very fast.
reviews.title: You dont always get what you pay for.

reviews.text: Did not eat here.
reviews.title: A decent enough hotel in a good location
